meanings.definition: Youngs (noun): A group of young people.
meanings.sent1: The youngs played happily in the park.
meanings.sent2: The youngs gathered for a study session.
meanings.sent3: The youngs organized a surprise party for their friend.
meanings.sent4: The youngs blossomed into talented musicians.
meanings.sent5: The youngs' energy was contagious during the game.

meanings.definition: Youngs (adjective): In an early stage of life or growth; not old.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was so youngs and playful.
meanings.sent2: She had a youngs mind full of curiosity.
meanings.sent3: The youngs tree swayed in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her youngs spirit shone brightly in the room.
meanings.sent5: The youngs flowers bloomed beautifully in the garden.

meanings.definition: Youngs (verb): To become younger or more youthful.
meanings.sent1: She youngs gracefully with each passing year.
meanings.sent2: The potion promised to youngs the skin.
meanings.sent3: He youngs himself by staying active.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to youngs the world around.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter seemed to youngs the room with joy.
